Search form Search Contact Us | Site Map | Font Size A A A | Accessibility The Weather Network You are hereHome › Customer Services › Short Term Rentals Short Term Rentals Short Term Rentals Bed and Breakfast Establishments, Cottage Rentals, Country Inns, Vacation Apartments and Villas Short Term Rental Application Package 2020 Application - please fill in and print the application. Please note this process will take between 4 - 6 weeks. Please note: 2020 Short Term Rental Application fees are currently $115/room. Please be advised that only complete applications will be accepted. A complete application will includes the following; a signed application form and acknowledgement form; a copy of a valid certificate of insurance; scaled site plans and floor plans; and the payment of the applicable licensing fee. Licensing fees can be paid via cash, debit or cheque payable to The Corporation of the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. The Town will now only be accepting annual payments. In order to operate in the current licensing period, a current license will need to be issued and posted within each Short Term Rental establishment. All Short Term Rentals within the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake must be licensed in order to operate. Please also note: Web-sites, such as, Airbnb, VRBO etc., are only a means to advertise. In the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake you must hold a valid Short Term Rental License to operate. Applications can be submitted at the Town Administration Building located at 1593 Four Mile Creek Road during regular office hours (8:30 am to 4:30 pm). Should you have any questions concerning this process, please contact the Town Municipal Offices at 905-468-3266 and we would be pleased to assist you. ﻿ Short Term Rentals | Niagara on the Lake Skip to main content State of Emergency. Click here for details. Staff is happy to serve you online and over the phone while Town Hall remains closed to the public. Search form Search Contact Us | Site Map | Font Size A A A | Accessibility The Weather Network You are hereHome › Customer Services › Short Term Rentals Short Term Rentals Short Term Rentals Bed and Breakfast Establishments, Cottage Rentals, Country Inns, Vacation Apartments and Villas Short Term Rental Application Package 2020 Application - please fill in and print the application. Please note this process will take between 4 - 6 weeks. Please note: 2020 Short Term Rental Application fees are currently $115/room. Please be advised that only complete applications will be accepted. A complete application will includes the following; a signed application form and acknowledgement form; a copy of a valid certificate of insurance; scaled site plans and floor plans; and the payment of the applicable licensing fee. Licensing fees can be paid via cash, debit or cheque payable to The Corporation of the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. The Town will now only be accepting annual payments. In order to operate in the current licensing period, a current license will need to be issued and posted within each Short Term Rental establishment. All Short Term Rentals within the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake must be licensed in order to operate. Please also note: Web-sites, such as, Airbnb, VRBO etc., are only a means to advertise. In the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake you must hold a valid Short Term Rental License to operate. Applications can be submitted at the Town Administration Building located at 1593 Four Mile Creek Road during regular office hours (8:30 am to 4:30 pm). Should you have any questions concerning this process, please contact the Town Municipal Offices at 905-468-3266 and we would be pleased to assist you. ﻿ Short Term Rentals | Niagara on the Lake Skip to main content State of Emergency. Click here for details. Staff is happy to serve you online and over the phone while Town Hall remains closed to the public. Search form Search Contact Us | Site Map | Font Size A A A | Accessibility The Weather Network You are hereHome › Customer Services › Short Term Rentals Short Term Rentals Short Term Rentals Bed and Breakfast Establishments, Cottage Rentals, Country Inns, Vacation Apartments and Villas Short Term Rental Application Package 2020 Application - please fill in and print the application. Please note this process will take between 4 - 6 weeks. Please note: 2020 Short Term Rental Application fees are currently $115/room. Please be advised that only complete applications will be accepted. A complete application will includes the following; a signed application form and acknowledgement form; a copy of a valid certificate of insurance; scaled site plans and floor plans; and the payment of the applicable licensing fee. Licensing fees can be paid via cash, debit or cheque payable to The Corporation of the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. The Town will now only be accepting annual payments. In order to operate in the current licensing period, a current license will need to be issued and posted within each Short Term Rental establishment. All Short Term Rentals within the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake must be licensed in order to operate. Please also note: Web-sites, such as, Airbnb, VRBO etc., are only a means to advertise. In the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake you must hold a valid Short Term Rental License to operate. Applications can be submitted at the Town Administration Building located at 1593 Four Mile Creek Road during regular office hours (8:30 am to 4:30 pm). Should you have any questions concerning this process, please contact the Town Municipal Offices at 905-468-3266 and we would be pleased to assist you. Public Notice: Heritage Trail Temporary Closure The Heritage Trail, from Charlotte Street to East West Line, will close temporarily from June 14 to July 21 for rehabilitation. Click here to read the public notice. Media Release - NOTL Prepares to Move to Step One of Roadmap to Reopen Click here to read the media release. For more information, visit notl.com/COVID-19. Road Closure Notice: Anderson Lane Anderson Lane, from the mid point of Anderson Lane to Simcoe Street, will be closed to traffic June 7-21, 2021, for construction. Hot and humid conditions are expected to continue. For relief from the heat, visit #NOTL's Cooling Centre located in the Market Room of the Courthouse (26 Queen Street). The centre is open today from 12-4 PM. Media Release - NOTL Advances its Modernization & Digitization Efforts Dog licenses and online screening forms are now available online! Click here to read the media release. Public Notice - Installation of an All-Way Stop at the Intersection of Queen St. and Mississagua St. New stop signs will be erected on August 3, 2021. The intersection will be closed with detour signs posted. Click here to read the public notice. Mail Out - Service Line Warranties of Canada Residents can expect a mailout from Service Line Warranties of Canada beginning the week of July 26, 2021. Visit notl.com/content/service-line-warranty-program for more information. Hydrant Flow Testing & Maintenance Checks Workers are conducting flow testing and maintenance checks on hydrants in the Old Town (excluding Queen Street) July 26-30. Click here for more information. Temporary Speed Reduction - Regional Road 55 (Niagara Stone Road) Effective Monday, July 26, speed will be temporarily reduced to 50km/hr on Niagara Stone Rd. from 600m South of Line 4 Rd. to 70m South of Line 3 Rd. Click here to read the public notice. Media Release - NOTL Presents a Family-Friendly Park Hop Click here to read the media release. Visit notl.com/parkhop for more information. Media Release - NOTL Opens Indoor Cooling Centre Click here to read the media release. Notice of Electronic Public Meeting - Transportation Master Plan Click here for more information about the Virtual Public Consultation Meetings on July 29. Heat Warning In Effect There's a heat warning for the Niagara Region in effect today. Hot and humid conditions are expected. For relief from the heat, visit Niagara-on-the-Lake's Cooling Centre located in the Market Room of the Courthouse (26 Queen Street). The centre is open today from 12-4 PM Media Release - NOTL Advances its Modernization & Digitization Efforts Dog licenses and online screening forms are now available online! Click here to read the media release. Public Notice - Installation of an All-Way Stop at the Intersection of Queen St. and Mississagua St. New stop signs will be erected on August 3, 2021. The intersection will be closed with detour signs posted. Click here to read the public notice. Mail Out - Service Line Warranties of Canada Residents can expect a mailout from Service Line Warranties of Canada beginning the week of July 26, 2021. Visit notl.com/content/service-line-warranty-program for more information. Hydrant Flow Testing & Maintenance Checks Workers are conducting flow testing and maintenance checks on hydrants in the Old Town (excluding Queen Street) July 26-30. Click here for more information. Temporary Speed Reduction - Regional Road 55 (Niagara Stone Road) Effective Monday, July 26, speed will be temporarily reduced to 50km/hr on Niagara Stone Rd. from 600m South of Line 4 Rd. to 70m South of Line 3 Rd. Click here to read the public notice. Media Release - NOTL Presents a Family-Friendly Park Hop Click here to read the media release. Visit notl.com/parkhop for more information.
